ResourceCache

ResourceCache

new ResourceCache(name, pkAttr, options)

Source:
  • cache/cacheService.js, line 52
See:
  • ResourceCacheService

Constructs cache instances that can be used for caching resources. Instances of this cache class are
capable of invalidating related caches, updating resource list instances when getting data from
detail calls and respecting the dataAttr of resource instances. Use ResourceCacheService to
get the constructor.

Examples
// Define a cache instance as factory.
 angular.module('example').factory('ExampleResourceCache',
     function(ResourceCacheService) {
         return new ResourceCacheService('MyExampleResourceCache', 'pk', {
             urlAttr: 'url'
         });
     }
 );
// Putting data to the cache
 ExampleResourceCache.put(123, {pk: 123, attr1: 1, attr2: 2}, false);
// Getting cache information
 ExampleResourceCache.info();
// Getting $http compatible cache instance for calls using `dataAttr`
 ExampleResourceCache.withDataAttr;
 // Getting $http compatible cache instance for calls not using `dataAttr`
 ExampleResourceCache.withoutDataAttr;
Parameters:
Name Type Description
name String

Name of the cache
pkAttr String

Name of the primary key attribute on cached instances
options Object

Additional configuration

Properties
Name Type Description
urlAttr String | null

Name of the attribute to get the URL of the objects (default: null)
dataAttr String | null

Name of the attribute to get the actual data from (default: null)
dependent Array.<String>

List of dependent cache names (default: [])
ttl int

Time to live for cache entries in seconds (default: 3600)

of the info method on the cache.

Source:

Gets the entry with the given key from the cache, or undefined.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
key String

Cache entry key
useCacheTtl Boolean <optional>

If true this method will return undefined when the TTL of the entry is outreached (default: true)

insert(key, value, useDataAttr, refreshopt)

Source:
  • cache/cacheService.js, line 174

Creates a cache entry for the given value and puts it on the cache.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
key String

Cache entry key
value *

Cache entry value
useDataAttr Boolean

Use the dataAttr to get actual cache entry value
refresh Boolean <optional>

Refresh the existing cache entries by using the new value

Source:
  • cache/cacheService.js, line 211

Puts the given entry with the given key on the cache.

Name Type Description

Cache entry key
value *

Cache entry value
useDataAttr Boolean

Use the dataAttr to get actual cache entry value

refresh(value)

Source:
  • cache/cacheService.js, line 147

Refreshes the cache entries with the new value or values. The existing objects in the cache
are matched by the pkAttr value, and additionally by the urlAttr, if available.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
value Object | Array.<Object>

Instance or list of instances used to refresh data on the cache

remove(key)

Source:
  • cache/cacheService.js, line 304

Removes the entry with the given key from the cache.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
key String

Cache entry key

removeAll()

Source:
  • cache/cacheService.js, line 323

Removes all entries from the cache.

removeAllDependent()

Source:
  • cache/cacheService.js, line 403

Removes all entries of the dependent caches, including the dependent caches of the
dependent caches (and so on ...).

removeAllLists()

Source:
  • cache/cacheService.js, line 343

Removes all list entries from the cache.

removeAllObjects()

Source:
  • cache/cacheService.js, line 363

Removes all list entries from the cache.

removeAllRaw()

Source:
  • cache/cacheService.js, line 383
